Name: ArchiCrypt Live
Hidden containers: yesSecret-containers and Camouflage files ArchiCrypt Live Description

Name: BestCrypt
Multiple keys: yesSupported by the BestCrypt container format, see BestCrypt SDK
Two-factor authentication: yesSupported by the BestCrypt Volume Encryption software

Name: BitLocker
Custom authentication: yesBitLocker Drive Encryption: Value Add Extensibility Options

Name: CipherShed
Multiple keys: yes with multiple keyfilesAlthough each volume encrypted with CipherShed can only have one active master key, it is possible to access its contents through more than one header. Each header can have a different password and/or keyfiles if any (cf. TrueCrypt FAQ: Is there a way for an administrator to reset a volume password or pre-boot authentication password when a user forgets it (or loses a keyfile)?)
Filesystems: Only Windows MBR volumes, no UEFI GPT drives, and dynamic drives discouragedfix-attempted=yes

Name: Cryptoloop
Pre-boot authentication: yesdm-crypt and cryptoloop volumes can be mounted from the initrd before the system is booted

Name: DiskCryptor
Filesystems: Only Windows MBR volumes, no UEFI GPT drives, ReFs

Name: FreeOTFE
Custom authentication: yesFreeOTFE has a modular architecture and set of components to allow 3rd party integration
Multiple keys: yesFreeOTFE allows multiple keys to mount the same container file via encrypted keyfiles

Name: n-Crypt Pro
Passphrase strengthening: n/an-Crypt Pro does not use password authenticationâ€” biometric/USB dongle authentication only

Name: PGPDisk
Passphrase strengthening: yesPGP private keys are always protected by strengthened passphrases

TPM: yes{{cite web|url= Security: Trusted Platform Module Technology Comes of Age|publisher=Utimaco|access-date=2008-03-04|url-status=dead|archive-url=

Filesystems: ext2, ext3, reiserfs, minix, ntfs, vfat/msdos

Passphrase strengthening: yesoptional by using -K OpenBSD Manual Pages: vnconfig(8)

Name: TrueCrypt TrueCryptMystery
Multiple keys: yes with multiple keyfilesAlthough each volume encrypted with TrueCrypt can only have one active master key, it is possible to access its contents through more than one header. Each header can have a different password and/or keyfiles if any (cf. TrueCrypt FAQ: Is there a way for an administrator to reset a volume password or pre-boot authentication password when a user forgets it (or loses a keyfile)?)
Filesystems: Only Windows MBR volumes, no UEFI GPT drives, and dynamic drives discouragedfix-attempted=yes

Name: VeraCrypt
Filesystems: Windows on both MBR and UEFI GPT drives, dynamic drives discouraged

Name: CyberSafe Top Secret
Filesystems: Only Windows MBR volumes, no UEFI GPT drives, and dynamic drives discouraged
